de.purpose: Zur Darstellung von Details über den Standort einer Person, eines physischen Gebäudes oder einer Landmarke, wie sie im Rahmen der klinischen Dokumentation bekannt sind oder verstanden werden.
de.use:
*Use to record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation, often ad hoc or when it is not appropriate or possible to use an address lookup service. Examples include:
- the business address of an organisation providing home care to an individual; or
- the postal address of the copyholder of an advanced care record, within the EVALUATION.advance_care_directive archetype; or
- the physical location of a fall or accident.

The scope of this archetype has been constrained to carry the commonest structured components for identifying a specific physical building or landmark. In this context, a complete address may be described using:
- One or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded; and
- 'Town' to represent a suburb, town, city, village, or community;
- 'District/County' to represent a local government district;
- 'State/Territory/Province’ to represent a major government district;
- ‘Postcode’, and 
- ‘Country'.
However, this archetype can be extended to include additional fine-grained details about the address by nesting the CLUSTER.structured address within the 'Structured address' SLOT.

This CLUSTER.address could also be used as a proxy for an address in formal demographic address data when reviewing a template with domain experts - for example, an assessment where reviewers would expect to see the individual's full contact details at the top of the assessment form. (en)
de.misuse:
Darf nicht verwendet werden, um eine vollständig strukturierte Adresse, wie sie in ISO-Standards beschrieben ist, im Rahmen der Führung eines offiziellen demografischen Registers oder Index zu erfassen. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck einen Adresssuchdienst, einen formalen Master Patient Index oder Health Provider Index oder Archetypen, die auf dem openEHR Demographic Information Model basieren.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um digitale Adressen zur Verwendung in der elektronischen Kommunikation darzustellen. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.electronic_communication.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um Details über Wohnungs- oder Obdachlosigkeit darzustellen. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck den Archetyp EVALUATION.housing_summary.

nb.purpose: For å registrere detaljer om lokaliseringen til en person, en fysisk bygning eller et landemerke, som man har informasjon om eller har forstått, i det kliniske dokumentasjonsarbeidet.
nb.use:
*Use to record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation, often ad hoc or when it is not appropriate or possible to use an address lookup service. Examples include:
- the business address of an organisation providing home care to an individual; or
- the postal address of the copyholder of an advanced care record, within the EVALUATION.advance_care_directive archetype; or
- the physical location of a fall or accident.

The scope of this archetype has been constrained to carry the commonest structured components for identifying a specific physical building or landmark. In this context, a complete address may be described using:
- One or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded; and
- 'Town' to represent a suburb, town, city, village, or community;
- 'District/County' to represent a local government district;
- 'State/Territory/Province’ to represent a major government district;
- ‘Postcode’, and 
- ‘Country'.
However, this archetype can be extended to include additional fine-grained details about the address by nesting the CLUSTER.structured address within the 'Structured address' SLOT.

This CLUSTER.address could also be used as a proxy for an address in formal demographic address data when reviewing a template with domain experts - for example, an assessment where reviewers would expect to see the individual's full contact details at the top of the assessment form. (en)
nb.misuse:
Brukes ikke til å representere en fullstendig strukturert adresse, som beskrevet i ISO-standarder eller for å opprettholde et demografisk register eller en indeks. Bruk en adresseoppslagstjeneste, et formelt pasientregister, helsepersonellregister eller arketyper basert på openEHR demografisk informasjonsmodell til dette formålet.

Brukes ikke til å representere digitale adresser for bruk i elektronisk kommunikasjon. Bruk CLUSTER.electronic_communication (Elektronisk kommunikasjon) for dette formålet.

Brukes ikke for å registrere detaljer om bolig eller hjemløshet, Bruk arketypen EVALUATION.housing_summary (Boligsammendrag) for dette formålet.

en.purpose: To record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation.
en.use:
Use to record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation, often ad hoc or when it is not appropriate or possible to use an address lookup service. Examples include:
- the business address of an organisation providing home care to an individual; or
- the postal address of the copyholder of an advanced care record, within the EVALUATION.advance_care_directive archetype; or
- the physical location of a fall or accident.

The scope of this archetype has been constrained to carry the commonest structured components for identifying a specific physical building or landmark. In this context, a complete address may be described using:
- One or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded; and
- 'Town' to represent a suburb, town, city, village, or community;
- 'District/County' to represent a local government district;
- 'State/Territory/Province’ to represent a major government district;
- ‘Postcode’, and 
- ‘Country'.
However, this archetype can be extended to include additional fine-grained details about the address by nesting the CLUSTER.structured_address within the 'Structured address' SLOT.

This CLUSTER.address archetype can also be used as a proxy for an address in formal demographic address data when reviewing a template with domain experts - for example, an assessment where reviewers would expect to see the individual's full contact details at the top of the assessment form.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record a fully structured address, such as described in ISO standards or as part of maintaining an official demographic register or index. Use an address lookup service, a formal Master Patient Index or a Health Provider Index for this purpose, or archetypes based on the openEHR Demographic Information Model.

Not to be used to represent digital addresses for use in electronic communication. Use CLUSTER.electronic_communication for this purpose.

Not to be used to record details about housing or homelessness. Use the EVALUATION.housing_summary for this purpose.

at0000.description: Details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark.

at0001.description: An unstructured address line representing all relevant street-level or post-box details that would support the identification of a location.
at0001.comment: Occurrences for this data element is set to 0..* to allow one or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded within the context of a specified 'Town'. Multiple address lines can be represented in a template, renamed as 'Address line 1', 'Address line 2,' etc. For example: '7A/52 Davis Street' or 'Apartment 7A' as Address line 1 with '52 Davis Street' as Address line 2; a roadside mail box location, such as 'RMB 725, Princes Highway'; or using a descriptive landmark, such as or 'Corner of Smith & Brown Streets' or 'Second house north of the general store with the red door'.

at0002.description: The name of the lowest level locality that contains the address.
at0002.comment: For example: suburb, town, city, settlement, village, or community. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'.

at0003.description: The name of a local government district or geographical area that contains the address.
at0003.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Surf Coast' and 'Yarra' local government councils in Victoria, Australia;and the Parishes of 'Saint Andrew' and 'Kingston' in Jamaica..

at0004.description: The name of a major government district or geographical area that contains the address.
at0004.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'New South Wales' and 'Queensland' in Australia; 'British Columbia' and 'Nova Scotia' in Canada; and the Counties of 'Cornwall', 'Middlesex' & 'Surrey' in Jamaica.

at0005.description: The code for a postal delivery area containing the address, as defined by the relevant postal delivery service.
at0005.comment: Also known as a postcode or ZIP code.

at0006.description: The name of the country containing the address.
at0006.comment: For example: Australia; Canada; Jamaica; or Norway. Coding with an external terminology, such as EN ISO 3166–1 Alpha 2 country code, is recommended.

at0007.description: Horizontal (y) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0007.comment: Latitude is represented by positive values north of the equator and negative values south of the equator. For example the latitude of the Eiffel Tower is 48.858093.

at0008.description: Horizontal (x) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0008.comment: Longitude is represented by negative values west of Prime Meridian and positive values east of Prime Meridian. For example the longitude of the Eiffel Tower is 2.294694.

at0009.description: The vertical coordinate of a geolocation representing height or depth of the address.
at0009.comment: For example, the altitude of the top of the Eiffel Tower is +324m.

at0010.description: The type of address.
at0010.comment: For example: physical or postal.

at0011.description: A physical location that can be visited.

at0012.description: Address used as a destination for mailing letters or parcels.

at0013.description: Address of a physical location, also used as a destination for mail.

at0014.description: The primary purpose or use for the address.

at0015.description: Address of the physical location of a business or office.

at0016.description: Address of where a person is living on a regular basis.

at0017.description: Address of where a person is living on a temporary basis.

at0018.description: Additional narrative about the address not captured in other fields.

at0019.description: Link to a location on an online map.
at0019.comment: For example: a location on a Google or iOS map.

at0020.description: Structured details or extensions to the address.
at0020.comment: For example: to represent a  structured, fine-grained address, or be used as standardised concepts that can be concatenated together to consistently construct a single 'Address line'.

at0021.description: Unique identifier that represents a precise geographical location.
at0021.comment: Also known as a geocode. For example: GPS coordinates concatenating longitude, latitude +/-altitude; Open Location Code or Plus Code; Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM); and geohash.

at0014.1.description: The primary purpose or use for the address.

at0007.1.description: Horizontal (y) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0007.1.comment: Latitude is represented by positive values north of the equator and negative values south of the equator. For example the latitude of the Eiffel Tower is 48.858093.

at0008.1.description: Horizontal (x) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0008.1.comment: Longitude is represented by negative values west of Prime Meridian and positive values east of Prime Meridian. For example the longitude of the Eiffel Tower is 2.294694.

at0009.1.description: The vertical coordinate of a geolocation representing height or depth of the address.
at0009.1.comment: For example, the altitude of the top of the Eiffel Tower is +324m.

at0019.1.description: Link to a location on an online map.
at0019.1.comment: For example: a location on a Google or iOS map.

at0021.1.description: Unique identifier that represents a precise geographical location.
at0021.1.comment: Also known as a geocode. For example: GPS coordinates concatenating longitude, latitude +/-altitude; Open Location Code or Plus Code; Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM); and geohash.

at0000.1.description: Details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark.

at0000.description: Informasjon om lokalisasjonen til en person, en fysisk bygning eller et landemerke.

at0001.description: En ustrukturert adresselinje som representerer alle gatenivå- eller postboksdetaljer som kan støtte identifikasjon av en lokalisering.
at0001.comment:
Forekomster for dette dataelementet er satt til 0..* for å tillate registrering av flere fritekst-"Adresselinje"-dataelementer for å representerer alle ulike måter man har behov for å uttrykke en «adresse» i kontekst av dataelementet «By». Flere adresselinjer kan representeres i et templat, omdøpt til 'Adresselinje 1', 'Adresselinje 2' osv.

For eksempel: 
 "7A/52 Davis Street" eller "Leilighet 7A" som adresselinje 1 og "52 Davis Street" som adresselinje 2; en postboksplassering langs veien, for eksempel "RMB 725, Princes Highway"; eller et beskrivende landemerke, for eksempel "På hjørnet mellom Storgaten og Lillegaten" eller "Det andre huset til høyre etter butikken med rød dør".

at0002.description: *The name of the lowest level locality that contains the address. (en)
at0002.comment: *For example: suburb, town, city, settlement, village, or community. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'. (en)

at0003.description: Navnet på et politisk eller geografisk område som inneholder adressen.
at0003.comment: Koding med ekstern terminologi er foretrukket om mulig. For eksempel: 'Surf Coast' og 'Yarra' lokale myndigheter i Victoria, Australia;og sognene 'Saint Andrew' og 'Kingston' på Jamaica.

at0004.description: Navnet på en politisk eller geografisk inndeling av et land som en del av adressen.
at0004.comment: Koding med ekstern terminologi er foretrukket om mulig. For eksempel: 'New South Wales og Queensland i Australia, 'Britisk Columbia' og 'Nova Scotia' i Canada; og fylkene 'Cornwall' og 'Middlesex' & 'Surrey' på Jamaica.

at0005.description: Koden for et postleveringsområde som er en del av adressen, og som er definert av den relevante postleveringstjenesten.
at0005.comment: I andre land kalles dette også ZIP kode.

at0006.description: Navnet på landet som en del av adressen.
at0006.comment: For eksempel: Australia, Canada, Jamaica eller Norge. Koding med ekstern terminologi, som for eksempel EN ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 landskode, er foretrukket om mulig.

at0007.description: Horisontal (y) koordinat for en geolokalisering for adressen.
at0007.comment: Breddegrad er representert med positive verdier nord for ekvator og negative verdier sør for ekvator. For eksempel er breddegraden til Eiffeltårnet 48.858093.

at0008.description: Horisontal (x) koordinat for en geolokalisering for adressen.
at0008.comment: Lengdegrad er representert med negative verdier vest for nullmeridianen og positive verdier øst for nullmeridianen. For eksempel er lengdegraden til Eiffeltårnet 2.294694.

at0009.description: Den vertikale koordinaten til en geolokasjon som representerer høyden eller dybden til adressen.
at0009.comment: For eksempel er høyden på toppen av Eiffeltårnet +324m.

at0010.comment: For eksempel: Fysisk adresse eller postadresse.

at0019.comment: For eksempel: en lokalisering i et Google eller iOS kart.

at0001.description: Eine unstrukturierte Adresszeile, die alle relevanten Details auf Straßenebene oder zum Postfach darstellt, die die Identifizierung eines Standorts unterstützen würden.
at0001.comment: Vorkommen für dieses Datenelement ist auf 0..* gesetzt, damit ein oder mehrere Freitext-„Adresszeilen“-Datenelemente die große Vielfalt an Möglichkeiten darstellen können, wie Details auf „Straßenebene“ möglicherweise im Kontext einer bestimmten "Stadt" erfasst werden müssen. Mehrere Adresszeilen können in einem Template dargestellt und in „Adresszeile 1“, „Adresszeile 2“ usw. umbenannt werden. Beispiel: „7A/52 Davis Street“ oder „Appartment 7A“ als Adresszeile 1 mit „52 Davis Street“ als Adresszeile 2; ein Postfachstandort am Straßenrand, wie z. B. „RMB 725, Princes Highway“ oder Verwendung eines beschreibenden Orientierungspunkts wie „Ecke Smith & Brown Street“ oder „Zweites Haus nördlich des Gemischtwarenladens mit der roten Tür“.

at0002.description: *The name of the lowest level locality that contains the address. (en)
at0002.comment: *For example: suburb, town, city, settlement, village, or community. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'. (en)

at0003.description: Der Name eines internen politischen Bezirks oder geografischen Gebiets, der/das die Adresse enthält.
at0003.comment: Die Codierung mit einer externen Terminologie wird nach Möglichkeit bevorzugt. Zum Beispiel. For example: Kommunalverwaltungen 'Surf Coast“ und „Yarra“ in Victoria, Australien und die Grafschaften "Cornwall", Australia; und die Pfarreien von „Saint Andrew“ und „Kingston“ in Jamaika(en)

at0004.description: Der Name eines großen politischen Bezirks oder geografischen Gebiets, der/das die Adresse enthält.
at0004.comment: Die Codierung mit einer externen Terminologie wird nach Möglichkeit bevorzugt. Zum Beispiel: „New South Wales“ und „Queensland“ in Australien; „British Columbia“ und „Nova Scotia“ in Kanada; und die Grafschaften „Cornwall",„Middlesex" und „Surrey" in Jamaika.

at0005.description: Der Code für einen Postzustellungsbereich, der die Adresse enthält, wie vom jeweiligen Postzustelldienst definiert.
at0005.comment: Auch als Postleitzahl PLZ bekannt.

at0006.description: Der Name des Landes, in dem sich die Adresse befindet.
at0006.comment: Zum Beispiel: Australien, Kanada, Jamaika oder Norwegen. Die Codierung mit einer externen Terminologie, wie z. B. EN ISO 3166–1 Alpha 2 Ländercode, wird empfohlen.

at0007.description: Horizontale (y) Koordinate einer Geolokalisierung für die Adresse.
at0007.comment: Der Breitengrad wird durch positive Werte nördlich des Äquators und negative Werte südlich des Äquators dargestellt. Zum Beispiel ist der Breitengrad des Eiffelturms 48.858093.

at0008.description: Horizontale (x) Koordinate einer Geolokalisierung für die Adresse.
at0008.comment: Der Längengrad wird durch negative Werte westlich des Nullmeridians und positive Werte östlich des Nullmeridians dargestellt. Zum Beispiel ist der Längengrad des Eiffelturms 2.294694.

at0009.description: Die vertikale Koordinate einer Geolokalisierung, die die Höhe oder Tiefe der Adresse darstellt.
at0009.comment: Zum Beispiel, die Höhe der Spitze des Eiffelturms beträgt +324 m.

de.purpose: Zur Dokumentation des Personennamens eines Patienten, Verwandten, medizinischen Versorgers oder einer anderen dritten Person
de.use: Zur Dokumentation der Namensangaben einer Person
de.misuse: Nicht zur Erstaufzeichnung des Patientennamens zu benutzen. Nicht zur Identifikation von Individuen zu benutzen, die eindeutig Registern mit demografischen Daten zugeordnet werden können (z.B. einer elektronischen Krankenakte, einem Master Patient Index, etc.).

es-ar.purpose: Registrar el nombre personal de un paciente, familiar, proveedor de servicios de salud u otra tercera parte.
es-ar.use: Utilizar para registrar detalles del nombre de un individuo.
es-ar.misuse: No utilizar para el registro primario del nombre del paciente. No utilizar para identificar individuos que pueden ser unívocamente referenciados desde registros de datos demográficos. ej.: dentro del registro de salud electrónico, índices maestros de pacientes, etc.

pt-br.purpose: Registrar o nome pessoal de um paciente, parente, provedor de saúde ou terceiros.
pt-br.use: Usado para registrar detalhes do nome de um indivíduo.
pt-br.misuse: Não deve ser usado para registro primário do nome do paciente. Não deve ser usado para identificar os indivíduos que podem ser referenciados unicamente por meio de detalhes do registro demográfico p.e. registro eletrônico de saúde, prontuário eletrônico em saúde e etc.

en.purpose: To record the personal name of a patient, relative, healthcare provider or other third party.
en.use: Use to record name details about an individual.
en.misuse: Not to be used for primary recording of patient name. Not to be used to identify the individuals who can be uniquely referenced from registers of demographic details eg within the electronic health record, master patient indexes etc.

ar-sy.purpose: لتسجيل الاسم الشخصي للمريض, قريب المريض, مقدم الرعاية الصحية أو أي طرف ثالث.
ar-sy.use: لتسجيل تفاصيل الاسم حول شخص ما.
ar-sy.misuse: لا يستخدم للتسجيل الأولي لاسم المريض. لا يستخدم لتعريف الأفراد الذين يمكن الرجوع إليهم في سجلات التفاصيل الديموغرافية, مثلا: السجل الطبي الإلكتروني و فهرس المرضى الرئيسي.

de.purpose: Zur Darstellung von Details über den Standort einer Person, eines physischen Gebäudes oder einer Landmarke, wie sie im Rahmen der klinischen Dokumentation bekannt sind oder verstanden werden.
de.use:
*Use to record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation, often ad hoc or when it is not appropriate or possible to use an address lookup service. Examples include:
- the business address of an organisation providing home care to an individual; or
- the postal address of the copyholder of an advanced care record, within the EVALUATION.advance_care_directive archetype; or
- the physical location of a fall or accident.

The scope of this archetype has been constrained to carry the commonest structured components for identifying a specific physical building or landmark. In this context, a complete address may be described using:
- One or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded; and
- 'Town' to represent a suburb, town, city, village, or community;
- 'District/County' to represent a local government district;
- 'State/Territory/Province’ to represent a major government district;
- ‘Postcode’, and 
- ‘Country'.
However, this archetype can be extended to include additional fine-grained details about the address by nesting the CLUSTER.structured address within the 'Structured address' SLOT.

This CLUSTER.address could also be used as a proxy for an address in formal demographic address data when reviewing a template with domain experts - for example, an assessment where reviewers would expect to see the individual's full contact details at the top of the assessment form. (en)
de.misuse:
Darf nicht verwendet werden, um eine vollständig strukturierte Adresse, wie sie in ISO-Standards beschrieben ist, im Rahmen der Führung eines offiziellen demografischen Registers oder Index zu erfassen. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck einen Adresssuchdienst, einen formalen Master Patient Index oder Health Provider Index oder Archetypen, die auf dem openEHR Demographic Information Model basieren.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um digitale Adressen zur Verwendung in der elektronischen Kommunikation darzustellen. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.electronic_communication.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um Details über Wohnungs- oder Obdachlosigkeit darzustellen. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck den Archetyp EVALUATION.housing_summary.

nb.purpose: For å registrere detaljer om lokaliseringen til en person, en fysisk bygning eller et landemerke, som man har informasjon om eller har forstått, i det kliniske dokumentasjonsarbeidet.
nb.use:
*Use to record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation, often ad hoc or when it is not appropriate or possible to use an address lookup service. Examples include:
- the business address of an organisation providing home care to an individual; or
- the postal address of the copyholder of an advanced care record, within the EVALUATION.advance_care_directive archetype; or
- the physical location of a fall or accident.

The scope of this archetype has been constrained to carry the commonest structured components for identifying a specific physical building or landmark. In this context, a complete address may be described using:
- One or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded; and
- 'Town' to represent a suburb, town, city, village, or community;
- 'District/County' to represent a local government district;
- 'State/Territory/Province’ to represent a major government district;
- ‘Postcode’, and 
- ‘Country'.
However, this archetype can be extended to include additional fine-grained details about the address by nesting the CLUSTER.structured address within the 'Structured address' SLOT.

This CLUSTER.address could also be used as a proxy for an address in formal demographic address data when reviewing a template with domain experts - for example, an assessment where reviewers would expect to see the individual's full contact details at the top of the assessment form. (en)
nb.misuse:
Brukes ikke til å representere en fullstendig strukturert adresse, som beskrevet i ISO-standarder eller for å opprettholde et demografisk register eller en indeks. Bruk en adresseoppslagstjeneste, et formelt pasientregister, helsepersonellregister eller arketyper basert på openEHR demografisk informasjonsmodell til dette formålet.

Brukes ikke til å representere digitale adresser for bruk i elektronisk kommunikasjon. Bruk CLUSTER.electronic_communication (Elektronisk kommunikasjon) for dette formålet.

Brukes ikke for å registrere detaljer om bolig eller hjemløshet, Bruk arketypen EVALUATION.housing_summary (Boligsammendrag) for dette formålet.

en.purpose: To record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation.
en.use:
Use to record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation, often ad hoc or when it is not appropriate or possible to use an address lookup service. Examples include:
- the business address of an organisation providing home care to an individual; or
- the postal address of the copyholder of an advanced care record, within the EVALUATION.advance_care_directive archetype; or
- the physical location of a fall or accident.

The scope of this archetype has been constrained to carry the commonest structured components for identifying a specific physical building or landmark. In this context, a complete address may be described using:
- One or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded; and
- 'Town' to represent a suburb, town, city, village, or community;
- 'District/County' to represent a local government district;
- 'State/Territory/Province’ to represent a major government district;
- ‘Postcode’, and 
- ‘Country'.
However, this archetype can be extended to include additional fine-grained details about the address by nesting the CLUSTER.structured_address within the 'Structured address' SLOT.

This CLUSTER.address archetype can also be used as a proxy for an address in formal demographic address data when reviewing a template with domain experts - for example, an assessment where reviewers would expect to see the individual's full contact details at the top of the assessment form.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record a fully structured address, such as described in ISO standards or as part of maintaining an official demographic register or index. Use an address lookup service, a formal Master Patient Index or a Health Provider Index for this purpose, or archetypes based on the openEHR Demographic Information Model.

Not to be used to represent digital addresses for use in electronic communication. Use CLUSTER.electronic_communication for this purpose.

Not to be used to record details about housing or homelessness. Use the EVALUATION.housing_summary for this purpose.

at0000.description: Details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark.

at0001.description: An unstructured address line representing all relevant street-level or post-box details that would support the identification of a location.
at0001.comment: Occurrences for this data element is set to 0..* to allow one or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded within the context of a specified 'Town'. Multiple address lines can be represented in a template, renamed as 'Address line 1', 'Address line 2,' etc. For example: '7A/52 Davis Street' or 'Apartment 7A' as Address line 1 with '52 Davis Street' as Address line 2; a roadside mail box location, such as 'RMB 725, Princes Highway'; or using a descriptive landmark, such as or 'Corner of Smith & Brown Streets' or 'Second house north of the general store with the red door'.

at0002.description: The name of the lowest level locality that contains the address.
at0002.comment: For example: suburb, town, city, settlement, village, or community. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'.

at0003.description: The name of a local government district or geographical area that contains the address.
at0003.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Surf Coast' and 'Yarra' local government councils in Victoria, Australia;and the Parishes of 'Saint Andrew' and 'Kingston' in Jamaica..

at0004.description: The name of a major government district or geographical area that contains the address.
at0004.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'New South Wales' and 'Queensland' in Australia; 'British Columbia' and 'Nova Scotia' in Canada; and the Counties of 'Cornwall', 'Middlesex' & 'Surrey' in Jamaica.

at0005.description: The code for a postal delivery area containing the address, as defined by the relevant postal delivery service.
at0005.comment: Also known as a postcode or ZIP code.

at0006.description: The name of the country containing the address.
at0006.comment: For example: Australia; Canada; Jamaica; or Norway. Coding with an external terminology, such as EN ISO 3166–1 Alpha 2 country code, is recommended.

at0007.description: Horizontal (y) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0007.comment: Latitude is represented by positive values north of the equator and negative values south of the equator. For example the latitude of the Eiffel Tower is 48.858093.

at0008.description: Horizontal (x) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0008.comment: Longitude is represented by negative values west of Prime Meridian and positive values east of Prime Meridian. For example the longitude of the Eiffel Tower is 2.294694.

at0009.description: The vertical coordinate of a geolocation representing height or depth of the address.
at0009.comment: For example, the altitude of the top of the Eiffel Tower is +324m.

at0010.description: The type of address.
at0010.comment: For example: physical or postal.

at0011.description: A physical location that can be visited.

at0012.description: Address used as a destination for mailing letters or parcels.

at0013.description: Address of a physical location, also used as a destination for mail.

at0014.description: The primary purpose or use for the address.

at0015.description: Address of the physical location of a business or office.

at0016.description: Address of where a person is living on a regular basis.

at0017.description: Address of where a person is living on a temporary basis.

at0018.description: Additional narrative about the address not captured in other fields.

at0019.description: Link to a location on an online map.
at0019.comment: For example: a location on a Google or iOS map.

at0020.description: Structured details or extensions to the address.
at0020.comment: For example: to represent a  structured, fine-grained address, or be used as standardised concepts that can be concatenated together to consistently construct a single 'Address line'.

at0021.description: Unique identifier that represents a precise geographical location.
at0021.comment: Also known as a geocode. For example: GPS coordinates concatenating longitude, latitude +/-altitude; Open Location Code or Plus Code; Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM); and geohash.

at0014.1.description: The primary purpose or use for the address.

at0007.1.description: Horizontal (y) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0007.1.comment: Latitude is represented by positive values north of the equator and negative values south of the equator. For example the latitude of the Eiffel Tower is 48.858093.

at0008.1.description: Horizontal (x) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0008.1.comment: Longitude is represented by negative values west of Prime Meridian and positive values east of Prime Meridian. For example the longitude of the Eiffel Tower is 2.294694.

at0009.1.description: The vertical coordinate of a geolocation representing height or depth of the address.
at0009.1.comment: For example, the altitude of the top of the Eiffel Tower is +324m.

at0019.1.description: Link to a location on an online map.
at0019.1.comment: For example: a location on a Google or iOS map.

at0021.1.description: Unique identifier that represents a precise geographical location.
at0021.1.comment: Also known as a geocode. For example: GPS coordinates concatenating longitude, latitude +/-altitude; Open Location Code or Plus Code; Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM); and geohash.

at0000.1.description: Details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark.

at0000.description: Informasjon om lokalisasjonen til en person, en fysisk bygning eller et landemerke.

at0001.description: En ustrukturert adresselinje som representerer alle gatenivå- eller postboksdetaljer som kan støtte identifikasjon av en lokalisering.
at0001.comment:
Forekomster for dette dataelementet er satt til 0..* for å tillate registrering av flere fritekst-"Adresselinje"-dataelementer for å representerer alle ulike måter man har behov for å uttrykke en «adresse» i kontekst av dataelementet «By». Flere adresselinjer kan representeres i et templat, omdøpt til 'Adresselinje 1', 'Adresselinje 2' osv.

For eksempel: 
 "7A/52 Davis Street" eller "Leilighet 7A" som adresselinje 1 og "52 Davis Street" som adresselinje 2; en postboksplassering langs veien, for eksempel "RMB 725, Princes Highway"; eller et beskrivende landemerke, for eksempel "På hjørnet mellom Storgaten og Lillegaten" eller "Det andre huset til høyre etter butikken med rød dør".

at0002.description: *The name of the lowest level locality that contains the address. (en)
at0002.comment: *For example: suburb, town, city, settlement, village, or community. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'. (en)

at0003.description: Navnet på et politisk eller geografisk område som inneholder adressen.
at0003.comment: Koding med ekstern terminologi er foretrukket om mulig. For eksempel: 'Surf Coast' og 'Yarra' lokale myndigheter i Victoria, Australia;og sognene 'Saint Andrew' og 'Kingston' på Jamaica.

at0004.description: Navnet på en politisk eller geografisk inndeling av et land som en del av adressen.
at0004.comment: Koding med ekstern terminologi er foretrukket om mulig. For eksempel: 'New South Wales og Queensland i Australia, 'Britisk Columbia' og 'Nova Scotia' i Canada; og fylkene 'Cornwall' og 'Middlesex' & 'Surrey' på Jamaica.

at0005.description: Koden for et postleveringsområde som er en del av adressen, og som er definert av den relevante postleveringstjenesten.
at0005.comment: I andre land kalles dette også ZIP kode.

at0006.description: Navnet på landet som en del av adressen.
at0006.comment: For eksempel: Australia, Canada, Jamaica eller Norge. Koding med ekstern terminologi, som for eksempel EN ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 landskode, er foretrukket om mulig.

at0007.description: Horisontal (y) koordinat for en geolokalisering for adressen.
at0007.comment: Breddegrad er representert med positive verdier nord for ekvator og negative verdier sør for ekvator. For eksempel er breddegraden til Eiffeltårnet 48.858093.

at0008.description: Horisontal (x) koordinat for en geolokalisering for adressen.
at0008.comment: Lengdegrad er representert med negative verdier vest for nullmeridianen og positive verdier øst for nullmeridianen. For eksempel er lengdegraden til Eiffeltårnet 2.294694.

at0009.description: Den vertikale koordinaten til en geolokasjon som representerer høyden eller dybden til adressen.
at0009.comment: For eksempel er høyden på toppen av Eiffeltårnet +324m.

at0010.description: Adressetypen.
at0010.comment: For eksempel: Fysisk adresse eller postadresse.

at0011.description: Adressen til en fysisk lokalisering.

at0012.description: Adresse for korrespondanse, pakker eller brev.

at0013.description: Adresse både for en fysisk lokalisering og for korrespondanse.

at0014.description: Primærformål for bruk av adressen.

at0015.description: Adressen til den fysiske plasseringen av en bedrift eller et kontor.

at0016.description: Adressen hvor en person bor.

at0017.description: Adressen hvor en person bor på midlertidig basis.

at0018.description: Ytterligere fritekst om adressen som ikke er registrert i andre felt.

at0019.description: Lenke til en lokalisering på et online kart.
at0019.comment: For eksempel: en lokalisering i et Google eller iOS kart.

at0020.description: *Structured details or extensions to the address. (en)
at0020.comment: *For example: to represent a  structured, fine-grained address, or be used as standardised concepts that can be concatenated together to consistently construct a single 'Address line'. (en)

at0000.description: Informationen über den Standort einer Person, eines physischen Gebäudes oder einer Landmarke.

at0001.description: Eine unstrukturierte Adresszeile, die alle relevanten Details auf Straßenebene oder zum Postfach darstellt, die die Identifizierung eines Standorts unterstützen würden.
at0001.comment: Vorkommen für dieses Datenelement ist auf 0..* gesetzt, damit ein oder mehrere Freitext-„Adresszeilen“-Datenelemente die große Vielfalt an Möglichkeiten darstellen können, wie Details auf „Straßenebene“ möglicherweise im Kontext einer bestimmten "Stadt" erfasst werden müssen. Mehrere Adresszeilen können in einem Template dargestellt und in „Adresszeile 1“, „Adresszeile 2“ usw. umbenannt werden. Beispiel: „7A/52 Davis Street“ oder „Appartment 7A“ als Adresszeile 1 mit „52 Davis Street“ als Adresszeile 2; ein Postfachstandort am Straßenrand, wie z. B. „RMB 725, Princes Highway“ oder Verwendung eines beschreibenden Orientierungspunkts wie „Ecke Smith & Brown Street“ oder „Zweites Haus nördlich des Gemischtwarenladens mit der roten Tür“.

at0002.description: *The name of the lowest level locality that contains the address. (en)
at0002.comment: *For example: suburb, town, city, settlement, village, or community. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'. (en)

at0003.description: Der Name eines internen politischen Bezirks oder geografischen Gebiets, der/das die Adresse enthält.
at0003.comment: Die Codierung mit einer externen Terminologie wird nach Möglichkeit bevorzugt. Zum Beispiel. For example: Kommunalverwaltungen 'Surf Coast“ und „Yarra“ in Victoria, Australien und die Grafschaften "Cornwall", Australia; und die Pfarreien von „Saint Andrew“ und „Kingston“ in Jamaika(en)

at0004.description: Der Name eines großen politischen Bezirks oder geografischen Gebiets, der/das die Adresse enthält.
at0004.comment: Die Codierung mit einer externen Terminologie wird nach Möglichkeit bevorzugt. Zum Beispiel: „New South Wales“ und „Queensland“ in Australien; „British Columbia“ und „Nova Scotia“ in Kanada; und die Grafschaften „Cornwall",„Middlesex" und „Surrey" in Jamaika.

at0005.description: Der Code für einen Postzustellungsbereich, der die Adresse enthält, wie vom jeweiligen Postzustelldienst definiert.
at0005.comment: Auch als Postleitzahl PLZ bekannt.

at0006.description: Der Name des Landes, in dem sich die Adresse befindet.
at0006.comment: Zum Beispiel: Australien, Kanada, Jamaika oder Norwegen. Die Codierung mit einer externen Terminologie, wie z. B. EN ISO 3166–1 Alpha 2 Ländercode, wird empfohlen.

de.purpose: Zur Dokumentation des Personennamens eines Patienten, Verwandten, medizinischen Versorgers oder einer anderen dritten Person
de.use: Zur Dokumentation der Namensangaben einer Person
de.misuse: Nicht zur Erstaufzeichnung des Patientennamens zu benutzen. Nicht zur Identifikation von Individuen zu benutzen, die eindeutig Registern mit demografischen Daten zugeordnet werden können (z.B. einer elektronischen Krankenakte, einem Master Patient Index, etc.).

es-ar.purpose: Registrar el nombre personal de un paciente, familiar, proveedor de servicios de salud u otra tercera parte.
es-ar.use: Utilizar para registrar detalles del nombre de un individuo.
es-ar.misuse: No utilizar para el registro primario del nombre del paciente. No utilizar para identificar individuos que pueden ser unívocamente referenciados desde registros de datos demográficos. ej.: dentro del registro de salud electrónico, índices maestros de pacientes, etc.

pt-br.purpose: Registrar o nome pessoal de um paciente, parente, provedor de saúde ou terceiros.
pt-br.use: Usado para registrar detalhes do nome de um indivíduo.
pt-br.misuse: Não deve ser usado para registro primário do nome do paciente. Não deve ser usado para identificar os indivíduos que podem ser referenciados unicamente por meio de detalhes do registro demográfico p.e. registro eletrônico de saúde, prontuário eletrônico em saúde e etc.

en.purpose: To record the personal name of a patient, relative, healthcare provider or other third party.
en.use: Use to record name details about an individual.
en.misuse: Not to be used for primary recording of patient name. Not to be used to identify the individuals who can be uniquely referenced from registers of demographic details eg within the electronic health record, master patient indexes etc.

ar-sy.purpose: لتسجيل الاسم الشخصي للمريض, قريب المريض, مقدم الرعاية الصحية أو أي طرف ثالث.
ar-sy.use: لتسجيل تفاصيل الاسم حول شخص ما.
ar-sy.misuse: لا يستخدم للتسجيل الأولي لاسم المريض. لا يستخدم لتعريف الأفراد الذين يمكن الرجوع إليهم في سجلات التفاصيل الديموغرافية, مثلا: السجل الطبي الإلكتروني و فهرس المرضى الرئيسي.

de.purpose: Zur Darstellung von Details über den Standort einer Person, eines physischen Gebäudes oder einer Landmarke, wie sie im Rahmen der klinischen Dokumentation bekannt sind oder verstanden werden.
de.use:
*Use to record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation, often ad hoc or when it is not appropriate or possible to use an address lookup service. Examples include:
- the business address of an organisation providing home care to an individual; or
- the postal address of the copyholder of an advanced care record, within the EVALUATION.advance_care_directive archetype; or
- the physical location of a fall or accident.

The scope of this archetype has been constrained to carry the commonest structured components for identifying a specific physical building or landmark. In this context, a complete address may be described using:
- One or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded; and
- 'Town' to represent a suburb, town, city, village, or community;
- 'District/County' to represent a local government district;
- 'State/Territory/Province’ to represent a major government district;
- ‘Postcode’, and 
- ‘Country'.
However, this archetype can be extended to include additional fine-grained details about the address by nesting the CLUSTER.structured address within the 'Structured address' SLOT.

This CLUSTER.address could also be used as a proxy for an address in formal demographic address data when reviewing a template with domain experts - for example, an assessment where reviewers would expect to see the individual's full contact details at the top of the assessment form. (en)
de.misuse:
Darf nicht verwendet werden, um eine vollständig strukturierte Adresse, wie sie in ISO-Standards beschrieben ist, im Rahmen der Führung eines offiziellen demografischen Registers oder Index zu erfassen. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck einen Adresssuchdienst, einen formalen Master Patient Index oder Health Provider Index oder Archetypen, die auf dem openEHR Demographic Information Model basieren.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um digitale Adressen zur Verwendung in der elektronischen Kommunikation darzustellen. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.electronic_communication.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um Details über Wohnungs- oder Obdachlosigkeit darzustellen. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck den Archetyp EVALUATION.housing_summary.

nb.purpose: For å registrere detaljer om lokaliseringen til en person, en fysisk bygning eller et landemerke, som man har informasjon om eller har forstått, i det kliniske dokumentasjonsarbeidet.
nb.use:
*Use to record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation, often ad hoc or when it is not appropriate or possible to use an address lookup service. Examples include:
- the business address of an organisation providing home care to an individual; or
- the postal address of the copyholder of an advanced care record, within the EVALUATION.advance_care_directive archetype; or
- the physical location of a fall or accident.

The scope of this archetype has been constrained to carry the commonest structured components for identifying a specific physical building or landmark. In this context, a complete address may be described using:
- One or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded; and
- 'Town' to represent a suburb, town, city, village, or community;
- 'District/County' to represent a local government district;
- 'State/Territory/Province’ to represent a major government district;
- ‘Postcode’, and 
- ‘Country'.
However, this archetype can be extended to include additional fine-grained details about the address by nesting the CLUSTER.structured address within the 'Structured address' SLOT.

This CLUSTER.address could also be used as a proxy for an address in formal demographic address data when reviewing a template with domain experts - for example, an assessment where reviewers would expect to see the individual's full contact details at the top of the assessment form. (en)
nb.misuse:
Brukes ikke til å representere en fullstendig strukturert adresse, som beskrevet i ISO-standarder eller for å opprettholde et demografisk register eller en indeks. Bruk en adresseoppslagstjeneste, et formelt pasientregister, helsepersonellregister eller arketyper basert på openEHR demografisk informasjonsmodell til dette formålet.

Brukes ikke til å representere digitale adresser for bruk i elektronisk kommunikasjon. Bruk CLUSTER.electronic_communication (Elektronisk kommunikasjon) for dette formålet.

Brukes ikke for å registrere detaljer om bolig eller hjemløshet, Bruk arketypen EVALUATION.housing_summary (Boligsammendrag) for dette formålet.

en.purpose: To record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation.
en.use:
Use to record details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation, often ad hoc or when it is not appropriate or possible to use an address lookup service. Examples include:
- the business address of an organisation providing home care to an individual; or
- the postal address of the copyholder of an advanced care record, within the EVALUATION.advance_care_directive archetype; or
- the physical location of a fall or accident.

The scope of this archetype has been constrained to carry the commonest structured components for identifying a specific physical building or landmark. In this context, a complete address may be described using:
- One or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded; and
- 'Town' to represent a suburb, town, city, village, or community;
- 'District/County' to represent a local government district;
- 'State/Territory/Province’ to represent a major government district;
- ‘Postcode’, and 
- ‘Country'.
However, this archetype can be extended to include additional fine-grained details about the address by nesting the CLUSTER.structured_address within the 'Structured address' SLOT.

This CLUSTER.address archetype can also be used as a proxy for an address in formal demographic address data when reviewing a template with domain experts - for example, an assessment where reviewers would expect to see the individual's full contact details at the top of the assessment form.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record a fully structured address, such as described in ISO standards or as part of maintaining an official demographic register or index. Use an address lookup service, a formal Master Patient Index or a Health Provider Index for this purpose, or archetypes based on the openEHR Demographic Information Model.

Not to be used to represent digital addresses for use in electronic communication. Use CLUSTER.electronic_communication for this purpose.

Not to be used to record details about housing or homelessness. Use the EVALUATION.housing_summary for this purpose.

at0000.1.description: Details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark.

at0000.description: Details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark.

at0001.description: An unstructured address line representing all relevant street-level or post-box details that would support the identification of a location.
at0001.comment: Occurrences for this data element is set to 0..* to allow one or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded within the context of a specified 'Town'. Multiple address lines can be represented in a template, renamed as 'Address line 1', 'Address line 2,' etc. For example: '7A/52 Davis Street' or 'Apartment 7A' as Address line 1 with '52 Davis Street' as Address line 2; a roadside mail box location, such as 'RMB 725, Princes Highway'; or using a descriptive landmark, such as or 'Corner of Smith & Brown Streets' or 'Second house north of the general store with the red door'.

at0002.description: The name of the lowest level locality that contains the address.
at0002.comment: For example: suburb, town, city, settlement, village, or community. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'.

at0003.description: The name of a local government district or geographical area that contains the address.
at0003.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Surf Coast' and 'Yarra' local government councils in Victoria, Australia;and the Parishes of 'Saint Andrew' and 'Kingston' in Jamaica..

at0004.description: The name of a major government district or geographical area that contains the address.
at0004.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'New South Wales' and 'Queensland' in Australia; 'British Columbia' and 'Nova Scotia' in Canada; and the Counties of 'Cornwall', 'Middlesex' & 'Surrey' in Jamaica.

at0005.description: The code for a postal delivery area containing the address, as defined by the relevant postal delivery service.
at0005.comment: Also known as a postcode or ZIP code.

at0006.description: The name of the country containing the address.
at0006.comment: For example: Australia; Canada; Jamaica; or Norway. Coding with an external terminology, such as EN ISO 3166–1 Alpha 2 country code, is recommended.

at0007.description: Horizontal (y) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0007.comment: Latitude is represented by positive values north of the equator and negative values south of the equator. For example the latitude of the Eiffel Tower is 48.858093.

at0008.description: Horizontal (x) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0008.comment: Longitude is represented by negative values west of Prime Meridian and positive values east of Prime Meridian. For example the longitude of the Eiffel Tower is 2.294694.

at0009.description: The vertical coordinate of a geolocation representing height or depth of the address.
at0009.comment: For example, the altitude of the top of the Eiffel Tower is +324m.

at0010.description: The type of address.
at0010.comment: For example: physical or postal.

at0011.description: A physical location that can be visited.

at0012.description: Address used as a destination for mailing letters or parcels.

at0013.description: Address of a physical location, also used as a destination for mail.

at0014.description: The primary purpose or use for the address.

at0015.description: Address of the physical location of a business or office.

at0016.description: Address of where a person is living on a regular basis.

at0017.description: Address of where a person is living on a temporary basis.

at0018.description: Additional narrative about the address not captured in other fields.

at0019.description: Link to a location on an online map.
at0019.comment: For example: a location on a Google or iOS map.

at0020.description: Structured details or extensions to the address.
at0020.comment: For example: to represent a  structured, fine-grained address, or be used as standardised concepts that can be concatenated together to consistently construct a single 'Address line'.

at0021.description: Unique identifier that represents a precise geographical location.
at0021.comment: Also known as a geocode. For example: GPS coordinates concatenating longitude, latitude +/-altitude; Open Location Code or Plus Code; Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM); and geohash.

at0014.1.description: The primary purpose or use for the address.

at0007.1.description: Horizontal (y) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0007.1.comment: Latitude is represented by positive values north of the equator and negative values south of the equator. For example the latitude of the Eiffel Tower is 48.858093.

at0008.1.description: Horizontal (x) coordinate of a geolocation for the address.
at0008.1.comment: Longitude is represented by negative values west of Prime Meridian and positive values east of Prime Meridian. For example the longitude of the Eiffel Tower is 2.294694.

at0009.1.description: The vertical coordinate of a geolocation representing height or depth of the address.
at0009.1.comment: For example, the altitude of the top of the Eiffel Tower is +324m.

at0019.1.description: Link to a location on an online map.
at0019.1.comment: For example: a location on a Google or iOS map.

at0021.1.description: Unique identifier that represents a precise geographical location.
at0021.1.comment: Also known as a geocode. For example: GPS coordinates concatenating longitude, latitude +/-altitude; Open Location Code or Plus Code; Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM); and geohash.

at0000.description: Informasjon om lokalisasjonen til en person, en fysisk bygning eller et landemerke.

at0001.description: En ustrukturert adresselinje som representerer alle gatenivå- eller postboksdetaljer som kan støtte identifikasjon av en lokalisering.
at0001.comment:
Forekomster for dette dataelementet er satt til 0..* for å tillate registrering av flere fritekst-"Adresselinje"-dataelementer for å representerer alle ulike måter man har behov for å uttrykke en «adresse» i kontekst av dataelementet «By». Flere adresselinjer kan representeres i et templat, omdøpt til 'Adresselinje 1', 'Adresselinje 2' osv.

For eksempel: 
 "7A/52 Davis Street" eller "Leilighet 7A" som adresselinje 1 og "52 Davis Street" som adresselinje 2; en postboksplassering langs veien, for eksempel "RMB 725, Princes Highway"; eller et beskrivende landemerke, for eksempel "På hjørnet mellom Storgaten og Lillegaten" eller "Det andre huset til høyre etter butikken med rød dør".

at0002.description: *The name of the lowest level locality that contains the address. (en)
at0002.comment: *For example: suburb, town, city, settlement, village, or community. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'. (en)

at0003.description: Navnet på et politisk eller geografisk område som inneholder adressen.
at0003.comment: Koding med ekstern terminologi er foretrukket om mulig. For eksempel: 'Surf Coast' og 'Yarra' lokale myndigheter i Victoria, Australia;og sognene 'Saint Andrew' og 'Kingston' på Jamaica.

at0004.description: Navnet på en politisk eller geografisk inndeling av et land som en del av adressen.
at0004.comment: Koding med ekstern terminologi er foretrukket om mulig. For eksempel: 'New South Wales og Queensland i Australia, 'Britisk Columbia' og 'Nova Scotia' i Canada; og fylkene 'Cornwall' og 'Middlesex' & 'Surrey' på Jamaica.

at0005.description: Koden for et postleveringsområde som er en del av adressen, og som er definert av den relevante postleveringstjenesten.
at0005.comment: I andre land kalles dette også ZIP kode.

at0006.description: Navnet på landet som en del av adressen.
at0006.comment: For eksempel: Australia, Canada, Jamaica eller Norge. Koding med ekstern terminologi, som for eksempel EN ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 landskode, er foretrukket om mulig.

at0007.comment: Breddegrad er representert med positive verdier nord for ekvator og negative verdier sør for ekvator. For eksempel er breddegraden til Eiffeltårnet 48.858093.

at0001.description: Eine unstrukturierte Adresszeile, die alle relevanten Details auf Straßenebene oder zum Postfach darstellt, die die Identifizierung eines Standorts unterstützen würden.
at0001.comment: Vorkommen für dieses Datenelement ist auf 0..* gesetzt, damit ein oder mehrere Freitext-„Adresszeilen“-Datenelemente die große Vielfalt an Möglichkeiten darstellen können, wie Details auf „Straßenebene“ möglicherweise im Kontext einer bestimmten "Stadt" erfasst werden müssen. Mehrere Adresszeilen können in einem Template dargestellt und in „Adresszeile 1“, „Adresszeile 2“ usw. umbenannt werden. Beispiel: „7A/52 Davis Street“ oder „Appartment 7A“ als Adresszeile 1 mit „52 Davis Street“ als Adresszeile 2; ein Postfachstandort am Straßenrand, wie z. B. „RMB 725, Princes Highway“ oder Verwendung eines beschreibenden Orientierungspunkts wie „Ecke Smith & Brown Street“ oder „Zweites Haus nördlich des Gemischtwarenladens mit der roten Tür“.

at0002.description: *The name of the lowest level locality that contains the address. (en)
at0002.comment: *For example: suburb, town, city, settlement, village, or community. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'. (en)

at0003.comment: Die Codierung mit einer externen Terminologie wird nach Möglichkeit bevorzugt. Zum Beispiel. For example: Kommunalverwaltungen 'Surf Coast“ und „Yarra“ in Victoria, Australien und die Grafschaften "Cornwall", Australia; und die Pfarreien von „Saint Andrew“ und „Kingston“ in Jamaika(en)

at0004.description: Der Name eines großen politischen Bezirks oder geografischen Gebiets, der/das die Adresse enthält.
at0004.comment: Die Codierung mit einer externen Terminologie wird nach Möglichkeit bevorzugt. Zum Beispiel: „New South Wales“ und „Queensland“ in Australien; „British Columbia“ und „Nova Scotia“ in Kanada; und die Grafschaften „Cornwall",„Middlesex" und „Surrey" in Jamaika.

at0005.description: Der Code für einen Postzustellungsbereich, der die Adresse enthält, wie vom jeweiligen Postzustelldienst definiert.

at0006.description: Der Name des Landes, in dem sich die Adresse befindet.
at0006.comment: Zum Beispiel: Australien, Kanada, Jamaika oder Norwegen. Die Codierung mit einer externen Terminologie, wie z. B. EN ISO 3166–1 Alpha 2 Ländercode, wird empfohlen.

at0007.comment: Der Breitengrad wird durch positive Werte nördlich des Äquators und negative Werte südlich des Äquators dargestellt. Zum Beispiel ist der Breitengrad des Eiffelturms 48.858093.

fi.purpose: *To record details about a health-related goal and any associated targets and deadlines.(en)
fi.use:
*Use to record a health-related goal, as well as one or more specific, measurable targets that will support assessment of success or allow for recording difficulties in achieving the target.

This archetype is intended for use as a component of a care plan, COMPOSITION.care_plan, and will be versioned over time as any changes are made. For example, if a new goal is added to a care plan, or or any other change made, the data will be added/updated and the Care plan saved as a new version. It can be used in any other COMPOSITION or SECTION archetypes, where clinically relevant.(en)

es-ar.purpose: El registro de metas relativas a la salud y demás objetivos asociados, y sus fechas límite.
es-ar.use:
Utilizado para registrar metas relacionadas a la salud, asi como uno o mas objetivos específicos mensurables que permitan la evaluación del éxito o el registro de las dificultades para alcanzar el objetivo.
Este arquetipo pretende ser un componente de un plan de cuidados, COMPOSITION.care_plan, y será versionado a través del tiempo a medida que se realicen cambios. Por ejemplo, si una nueva meta es agregada a un plan de cuidados, o se realiza cualquier otro cambio, los datos serán agregados o actualizados y el plan almacenado como una nueva versión. Puede ser utilizado en cualquier otro arquetipo COMPOSITION o SECTION cuando sea clínicamente relevante.

pt-br.purpose: Para gravar detalhes sobre um objetico de saúde e as metas e prazos associados.
pt-br.use:
Use para gravar uma meta relacionada à saúde, bem como um ou mais alvos específicos e mensuráveis que irão apoiar a avaliação do sucesso ou permitir o registro de dificuldades em atingir o alvo.

Este arquétipo é destinado ao uso como um componente de um plano de cuidados, COMPOSITION.care_plan e vai ser versionado ao longo do tempo, como todas as alterações são feitas. Por exemplo, se uma nova meta é adicionada a um plano de cuidados, ou a qualquer outra alteração feita, os dados serão adicionados/atualizados e o plano de cuidados salvo como uma nova versão. Ele pode ser usado em qualquer outro arquétipo COMPOSITION ou SEÇTION, quando clinicamente relevante.

en.purpose: To record details about a health-related goal and any associated targets and deadlines.
en.use:
Use to record a health-related goal, as well as one or more specific, measurable targets that will support assessment of success or allow for recording difficulties in achieving the target.

This archetype is intended for use as a component of a care plan, COMPOSITION.care_plan, and will be versioned over time as any changes are made. For example, if a new goal is added to a care plan, or or any other change made, the data will be added/updated and the Care plan saved as a new version. It can be used in any other COMPOSITION or SECTION archetypes, where clinically relevant.

ar-sy.purpose: لتسجيل الأهداف العامة و الأهداف المُحَدَّدة القابلة للقياس (و ربما الإضافية) المؤدية إلى الهدف العام.

nl.purpose: Voor het vastleggen van gegevens over een gezondheidsgerelateerd doel en andere bijbehorende doelstellingen en deadlines.
nl.use:
Gebruik voor het vastleggen van een gezondheidsgerelateerd doel, als ook een of meerdere specifieke, meetbare doelstellingen die het beoordelen van een resultaat mogelijk maken of voor het mogelijke maken van het vastleggen van belemmeringen in het bereiken van de doelstelling.

Dit archetype is bedoeld voor gebruik als onderdeel van een zorgplan: COMPOSITION.care_plan en zal aparte versies krijgen wanneer er iets wijzigt. Bijvoorbeeld wanneer een nieuw doel toegevoegd wordt aan het zorgplan of als er andere veranderingen zijn, de data zal toegevoegd/gewijzigd worden in het zorgplan, en hiervan wordt een nieuwe versie opgeslagen. Het kan gebruikt worden in elk andere COMPOSTION of SECTION archetype, wanneer klinische relevant.

at0000.description: Um resultado desejado de saúde ou bem-estar, para o sujeito do cuidado.

at0001.description: @ internal @

at0002.description: O nome do resultado de saúde desejado.
at0002.comment: Por exemplo: reduzir a pressão sanguínea; diminuir 10 kg do peso corporal; ou controlar a diabete.

at0003.description: A data desejada ou proposta para alcançar a meta.

at0004.description: A data real que o objetivo foi alcançado ou abandonado.

at0005.description: Detalhes obre o alvo pretendido.
at0005.comment: Alvos múltiplos são permitidos. Em algumas situações, será exigido apenas um alvo. Em alguns cenários clínicos a meta pode exigir uma abordagem multifacetada, com uma série de metas que contribuem para um resultado objetivo bem sucedido. Além disso, alguns objetivos podem exigir alvos incrementais para serem ajustados sequencialmente durante um período de tempo.

at0006.description: O arquétipo e trajetória da nó para os dados do alvo.
at0006.comment: Por exemplo: o elemento de dados "Peso" no arquétipo OBSERVATION.body_weight.

at0007.description: O alvo pretendido.

at0008.description: A data desejada ou prevista para atingir o alvo.

at0009.description: A data real que o objetivo foi alcançado ou abandonado.

at0010.description: Nome do problema ou diagnóstico na qual espera-se ter impacto na resolução do objetivo.
at0010.comment: Por exemplo: Hipertensão arterial; obesidade; ou Diabetes Tipo 2.

at0011.description: Identificação do alvo pretendido.
at0011.comment: Por exemplo: pressão arterial sistólica abaixo 140 mmHg; perda de 10 kg de peso corporal; ou HBA1c dentro da normalidade.

at0012.description: A descrição do objetivo, incluindo os alvos a serem alcançados, se for importante.

at0013.description: Uma palavra, frase ou descrição resumida que representa o resultado efetivo atingido pelo objetivo.
at0013.comment: Codificação com uma terminologia é preferível, quando possível. Por exemplo: peso corporal planejado atingido; pobre controle da diabete; ou conclusão bem sucedida.

at0015.description: O objetivo proposto foi realizado.

at0016.description: O objetivo proposto foi parcialmente realizado.

at0017.description: O objetivo proposto não foi realizado ou foi abandonado.

at0018.description: Uma palavra, frase ou descrição resumida que representa o resultado efetivamente atingido pelo alvo.
at0018.comment: Codificação com uma terminologia é preferível, quando possível. Este elemento de dados poderia representar o sucesso ou o fracasso, ou algum estado entre quando o objetivo é concluído ou abandonado/removido do registro. Por exemplo: pobre controle de açúcar no sangue, ou conclusão bem sucedida.

at0019.description: O alvo foi atingido.

at0020.description: O alvo foi parcialmente alcançado.

at0021.description: O alvo não foi atingido ou foi abandonado.

at0022.description: Narrativa adicional sobre o objetivo não foram registrados em outros campos.
at0022.comment: Por exemplo: a razão porque o objetivo não foi alcançado, ou a descrição pela qual o objetivo foi parcialmente alcançado.

at0023.description: Narrativa adicional sobre o alvo que não foram registrados em outros campos.
at0023.comment: Por exemplo: o motivo pelo qual o alvo não foi alcançado, ou a razão pela qual o alvo foi parcialmente alcançado.

at0024.description: Descrição sobre o alvo pretendido.

at0025.description: A data prevista ou proposta para início dos trabalhos para o objetivo.
at0025.comment: Nota: esta data não pode ser a data da gravação do objetivo.

at0026.description: @ internal @

at0027.description: Informações adicionais necessárias para capturar o conteúdo local ou para alinhar com outros modelos de referência/formalismos.
at0027.comment: Por exemplo: os requisitos de informação local ou metadados adicionais para alinhar com o FHIR ou CIMI equivalentes.

at0028.description: Detalhes sobre a prontidão para mudar o comportamento para alcançar o objetivo desejado.

at0029.description: A data em que o objetivo foi atualizado pela última vez.

at0002.1.description: O nome do resultado de saúde desejado.
at0002.1.comment: Por exemplo: reduzir a pressão sanguínea; diminuir 10 kg do peso corporal; ou controlar a diabete.

at0000.1.description: Um resultado desejado de saúde ou bem-estar, para o sujeito do cuidado.

at0022.1.description: Narrativa adicional sobre o objetivo não foram registrados em outros campos.
at0022.1.comment: Por exemplo: a razão porque o objetivo não foi alcançado, ou a descrição pela qual o objetivo foi parcialmente alcançado.

at0000.description: Un desenlace deseado para la salud o el bienestar de un sujeto de cuidados.

at0001.description: @ internal @

at0002.description: El nombre del desenlace de salud deseado.
at0002.comment: Por ejemplo: disminuir la tensión arterial; pérdida de peso de 10 kilogramos; o control de la diabetes.

at0003.description: La fecha prevista o propuesta para el logro de la meta.

at0004.text: Fecha de finalización de la meta
at0004.description: La fecha efectiva en la cual la meta fue alcanzada o abandonada.

at0005.description: Detalle del objetivo previsto.
at0005.comment: Se permiten objetivos múltiples. En algunas situaciones, solo un objetivo será requerido. En algunos escenarios clínicos la meta puede requerir un enfoque multifacético, donde una cantidad de objetivos contribuyen al desenlace exitoso de un meta. Además, algunas metas pueden requerir objetivos incrementales que pueden ordenarse secuencialmente durante un período de tiempo.

at0006.description: El arquetipo y path al nodo de los datos del objetivo.
at0006.comment: Por ejemplo: el elemento 'Peso' del arquetipo OBSERVATION.body_weight.

at0007.description: El objetivo previsto.

at0008.description: La fecha prevista o propuesta para el cumplimiento del objetivo.

at0009.description: La fecha real en la cual el objetivo fué alcanzado o abandonado.

at0010.description: Nombre del problema o diagnóstico que se pretende sea afectado mediante el logro de la meta.
at0010.comment: Por ejemplo: hipertensión; obesidad; o diabetes tipo 2.

at0011.description: Identificación por nombre del objetivo previsto.
at0011.comment: Por ejemplo: tensión arterial sistólica inferior a 140 mmHg; pérdida de 10 kilogramos; o HBA1c dentro de rangos normales.

at0012.description: Una descripción narrativa de la meta, incluyendo el/los objetivo/s a ser alcanzados si fuera relevante.

at0013.description: Palabra única, frase o descripción breve que representa el desenlace efectivamente alcanzado en relacion a la meta.
at0013.comment: Se prefiere la codificación mediante una terminología cuando sea posible. Por ejemplo: objetivo de peso alcanzado; control pobre de la diabetes; o cumplimiento exitoso.

at0015.description: La meta propuesta fue cumplida.

at0016.description: La meta propuesta fue parcialmente cumplida.

at0017.description: La meta propuesta no fué cumplida.

at0018.description: Palabra única, frase o descripción breve que representa el desenlace efectivamente alcanzado en relacion al objetivo.
at0018.comment: Se prefiere la codificación mediante una terminología cuando sea posible. Este dato puede representar el éxito o el fracaso o algun estado intermedio cuando la meta es alcanzada o abandonada/retirada del registro. Por ejemplo: control pobre de la glucemia, o cumplimiento exitoso.

at0019.description: El objetivo fué alcanzado.

at0020.description: El objetivo fué parcialmente alcanzado

at0021.description: El objetivo no fué alcanzado y fué abandonado.

at0022.description: Narración adicional acerca de la meta que no fue cubierto en otros campos.
at0022.comment: Por ejemplo: la razón por la cual la meta no fué cumplida, o la descripción acerca de como la meta fue parcialmente cumplida.

at0023.description: Narrativa adicional acerca del objetivo que no fué cubierto en otros campos.
at0023.comment: Por ejemplo: la razón por la cual el objetivo no fué logrado, o la descripción acerca de como el objetivo fué parcialmente alcanzado.

at0024.description: Descripción narrativa del objetivo previsto.

at0025.text: Fecha de inicio de la meta
at0025.description: La fecha prevista o propuesta para el comienzo del trabajo orientado a la meta.
at0025.comment: Nota: esta fecha puede no ser la fecha del registro de la meta.

at0026.description: @ internal @

at0027.description: Información adicional requerida para incluir contemplar contenido local o para alinear con otros modelos o formalismos de referencia.
at0027.comment: Por ejemplo: información local o metadatos adicionales para alinear con FHIR o CIMI equivalentes.

at0028.description: Detalles acerca de la disposición para el cambio del comportamiento dirigido al cumplimiento de la meta.

at0029.description: La fecha en la cual la meta fué actualizada por última vez.

at0002.1.description: El nombre del desenlace de salud deseado.
at0002.1.comment: Por ejemplo: disminuir la tensión arterial; pérdida de peso de 10 kilogramos; o control de la diabetes.

at0000.1.description: Un desenlace deseado para la salud o el bienestar de un sujeto de cuidados.

at0022.1.description: Narración adicional acerca de la meta que no fue cubierto en otros campos.
at0022.1.comment: Por ejemplo: la razón por la cual la meta no fué cumplida, o la descripción acerca de como la meta fue parcialmente cumplida.

at0000.description: Een voor de zorgontvanger gewenste uitkomst op het gebied van gezondheid of welbevinden.

at0001.description: @ internal @

at0002.description: De naam van het gewenste gezondheidsdoel.
at0002.comment: Bijvoorbeeld: afname van de bloeddruk, 10 kilogram gewichtsreductie of diabetes onder controle.

at0003.description: De gewenste of voorgestelde datum voor het het bereiken van het doel.

at0004.description: De werkelijke datum waarop het doel werd behaald of opgegeven.

at0005.description: Gegevens over het beoogde doel/de doelstelling/de streefwaarde.
at0005.comment: Meerdere doelstellingen zijn toegestaan. In sommige situaties is slechts een doelstelling vereist. In sommige klinische situaties wordt een multifactorieële benadering gevraagd met meerdere doelen die bijdragen aan een succesvol resultaat. Daarbij, sommige doelen vereisen stapsgewijze doelen opeenvolgend gesteld in de loop der tijd.

at0006.description: Het archetype en pad naar de node voor de data van de doelstelling.
at0006.comment: Bijvoorbeeld: 'gewicht' dataelement in het OBSERVATION.body_weight archetype.

at0007.description: De beoogde doelstelling.

at0008.description: De gewenste of voorgestelde datum voor het behalen van de doelstelling.

at0009.description: De daadwerkelijke datum waarop de doelstelling werd behaald of opgegeven.

at0010.description: Naam van het probleem of de diagnose die aangepakt wordt door het behalen van dit doel.
at0010.comment: Bijvoorbeeld: hypertensie, obesitas of diabetes type 2.

at0011.description: Benoemen van de beoogde doelstelling.
at0011.comment: Bijvoorbeeld: systolische bloeddruk onder 140 mmHg, gewichtsreductie van 10 kg of HBA1c binnen de normaalwaarde.

at0012.description: Een verhalende beschrijving van het doel, inclusief te behalen doelstellingen wanneer relevant.

at0013.description: Enkel woord, uitdrukking of korte beschrijving die het behaalde resultaat weergeeft van het doel.
at0013.comment: Coderen met een terminologie heeft, waar mogelijk, de voorkeur. Bijvoorbeeld: streefgewicht bereikt, diabetes slecht onder controle of succesvol afgerond.

at0015.description: Het voorgestelde doel is behaald.

at0016.description: Het voorgestelde doel is deel behaald.

at0017.description: Het voorgestelde doel is niet behaald of is opgegeven.

at0018.description: Enkel woord, uitdrukking of korte beschrijving die het werkelijk behaalde resultaat weergeeft van de doelstelling.
at0018.comment: Coderen met een terminologie heeft de voorkeur, waar mogelijk. Dit data element kan slagen of falen weergeven, of een andere status er tussenin wanneer het doel behaald is of opgegeven/verwijderd is uit het dossier. Bijvoorbeeld: glucose slecht onder controle of succesvol afgerond.

at0019.description: De doelstelling werd gerealiseerd.

at0020.description: De doelstelling werd gedeeltelijk behaald.

at0021.description: De doelstelling werd niet behaald of werd opgegeven.

at0022.description: Extra toelichting over het doel die niet past binnen andere velden.
at0022.comment: Bijvoorbeeld: de reden waarom het doen niet bereikt werd of een beschrijving op welke manier het doel deels behaald is.

at0023.description: Extra beschrijving over de doelstelling die niet past binnen andere velden.
at0023.comment: Bijvoorbeeld: de reden waarom de doelstelling niet behaald werd, of een beschrijving op welke manier een doelstelling gedeeltelijk is behaald.

at0024.description: Verhalende beschrijving van de beoogde doelstelling.

at0025.description: De verwachte of voorgestelde datum waarop begonnen wordt te werken richting het doel.
